node.title: 'Like a turducken of bin fires': Best political cartoons of 2021 highlight the absurdities of the year that was
node.alt: A drawing of a passport with stickers of places around the home on it
node.description: In a year where statistical models and predictions were at the forefront of all Australians minds, the Behind the Lines exhibition has set out to showcase all the other — unexpected — things that 2021 had to offer.
node.content:
["In a year where Australians sought consolation in statistical models and predictions, one thing became clear:\u00a0you just can't predict the future.", "And that's exactly what's on display at this year's Behind the Lines political cartoon exhibition.", "The annual exhibition offers up a satirical summary of the year that was in politics with 126 different artworks from more than 40 cartoonists.", "", "
Among the art on display at the exhibition\u00a0are works by\u00a0well-known cartoonist Mark Knight.(Supplied)
", "This year the theme of the exhibition is \"prophecy and chance\" \u2014 tapping into the idea that no one could have expected the year to unfold as it did.", "The exhibition is on show at the Museum of Australian Democracy at Old Parliament House in Canberra and museum director Daryl Karp said the curators \"drew inspiration\"\u00a0\u2014 quite literally \u2014\u00a0from the \"obsession\"\u00a0we developed in 2021 with forecasts and predictions.", "Ms Karp said she hoped the exhibition would provide some light relief after what was \"another crazy year\".", "", "
Peter Broelman's cartoon The\u00a0Canberra Bubble.(Supplied)
", "\"One of the things we set out \u2026\u00a0to say was: how do we have a sense of joy?\"", "\"Really we wanted that sense that we're getting through it, there is hope at the end of it all. And that was the one thing that we really tried quite hard to do.\"", "
Freelance cartoonist draws\u00a0top honour\u00a0
", "", "
Voted as the 2021 Political Cartoonist of the Year, Glen Le Lievre described the year as a \"bin fire\".(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "This year's Political Cartoonist of the Year is Glen Le Lievre, a freelance and crowd-sourced artist who was unanimously voted as the winner by the panel of judges.", "And, when asked about how he would describe 2021, he did\u00a0not shy away from expressing his views.", "\"It's like a bin fire, inside a bin fire, inside a bin fire. And then garbage\u00a0and a flaming bag of poo inside the successive three bin fires.\"", "He said he believed people were looking forward to the future after\u00a0a \"moody\" year.", "\"You don't want anything that focuses on the now or the present. So yeah, I think people would rather look to the future,\" he said.", "", "
The annual exhibition collates the best political cartoons of the year.(Supplied:\u00a0Cathy Wilcox)
", "For the artists involved in this year's program, it is\u00a0also a chance for their works to be appreciated on a wider scale.", "\"It's not just an exhibition about cartoons,\" Ms Karp said.", "\"Each of these artists in their own way are incredibly talented and really, really skilled at what they're doing.\"", "The exhibition is on show at the Museum of Australian Democracy until late next year."]
